team.unnamed.gui.item.type

Interface ItemBuilder

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultItemBuilder, FireworkBuilder, LeatherArmorBuilder

    public interface ItemBuilder
    An utility class to make the creation of custom items easier

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ItemBuilder addEnchant(org.bukkit.enchantments.Enchantment enchantment, java.lang.Integer level)
      Adds a enchantment for the ItemStack Multiple calls to this method with the same specified Enchantment will lead to overriding the last level for the enchantment
      ItemBuilder addFlag(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemFlag itemFlag)
      Adds a flag for the ItemStack Multiple calls to this method with the same specified ItemFlag will lead to the Flag being added multiple times
      org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack build()
      Builds the final ItemStack instance with the specified fields
      ItemBuilder enchants(java.util.Map<org.bukkit.enchantments.Enchantment,java.lang.Integer> enchantments)
      Sets a set of enchantments for the ItemStack Multiple calls to this method will override the last value set
      ItemBuilder flags(java.util.List<org.bukkit.inventory.ItemFlag> flags)
      Sets a set of flags for the ItemStack Multiple calls to this method will override the last value set
      ItemBuilder lore(java.util.List<java.lang.String> lore)
      Sets the lore for the ItemStack Multiple calls to this method will override the last value set
      ItemBuilder name(java.lang.String name)
      Sets the name for the ItemStack Multiple calls to this method will override the last value set
      static LeatherArmorBuilder newArmorBuilder(org.bukkit.Material material)
      Creates a new instance of LeatherArmorBuilder with the specified Material The specified Material should be any of the Leather pieces of armor like Material.LEATHER_CHESTPLATE, the builder won't raise an error when the Material isn't valid until you call the LeatherArmorBuilder.build() method
      static ItemBuilder newBuilder(org.bukkit.Material material)
      Creates a new instance of ItemBuilder with the specified Material
      static ItemBuilder newBuilder(org.bukkit.Material material, int amount)
      Creates a new instance of ItemBuilder with the specified Material and the specified amount
      static ItemBuilder newBuilder(org.bukkit.Material material, int amount, byte data)
      Creates a new instance of ItemBuilder with the specified Material, the specified amount and byte data
      static FireworkBuilder newFireworkBuilder(org.bukkit.Material material)
      Creates a new instance of FireworkBuilder with the specified Material The specified Material should be Material.FIREWORK, the builder won't raise an error when the Material isn't valid until you call the FireworkBuilder.build() method
      static FireworkBuilder newFireworkBuilder(org.bukkit.Material material, int amount)
      Creates a new instance of FireworkBuilder with the specified Material and the specified amount The specified Material should be Material.FIREWORK, the builder won't raise an error when the Material isn't valid until you call the FireworkBuilder.build() method

    • Method Detail

      • name

        ItemBuilder name(java.lang.String name)
        Sets the name for the ItemStack

        Multiple calls to this method will override the last value set

        Parameters:
        name - The new name for the ItemStack being build
        Returns:
        The same mutable instance of ItemBuilder

      • lore

        ItemBuilder lore(java.util.List<java.lang.String> lore)
        Sets the lore for the ItemStack

        Multiple calls to this method will override the last value set

        Parameters:
        lore - The new lore for the ItemStack being build
        Returns:
        The same mutable instance of ItemBuilder

      • enchants

        ItemBuilder enchants(java.util.Map<org.bukkit.enchantments.Enchantment,java.lang.Integer> enchantments)
        Sets a set of enchantments for the ItemStack

        Multiple calls to this method will override the last value set

        Parameters:
        enchantments - The new enchantments map for the ItemStack being build
        Returns:
        The same mutable instance of ItemBuilder

      • addEnchant

        ItemBuilder addEnchant(org.bukkit.enchantments.Enchantment enchantment,
                       java.lang.Integer level)
        Adds a enchantment for the ItemStack

        Multiple calls to this method with the same specified Enchantment will lead to overriding the last level for the enchantment

        Parameters:
        enchantment - The new Enchantment added to the ItemStack being build
        level - The level of the Enchantment being added
        Returns:
        The same mutable instance of ItemBuilder

      • flags

        ItemBuilder flags(java.util.List<org.bukkit.inventory.ItemFlag> flags)
        Sets a set of flags for the ItemStack

        Multiple calls to this method will override the last value set

        Parameters:
        flags - The new flags list for the ItemStack being build
        Returns:
        The same mutable instance of ItemBuilder

      • addFlag

        ItemBuilder addFlag(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemFlag itemFlag)
        Adds a flag for the ItemStack

        Multiple calls to this method with the same specified ItemFlag will lead to the Flag being added multiple times

        Parameters:
        itemFlag - The new ItemFlag added to the ItemStack being build
        Returns:
        The same mutable instance of ItemBuilder

      • build

        org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack build()
        Builds the final ItemStack instance with the specified fields
        Returns:
        A non null ItemStack instance

      • newBuilder

        static ItemBuilder newBuilder(org.bukkit.Material material)
        Creates a new instance of ItemBuilder with the specified Material
        Parameters:
        material - The material of the ItemStack to build
        Returns:
        A new instance of ItemBuilder

      • newBuilder

        static ItemBuilder newBuilder(org.bukkit.Material material,
                              int amount)
        Creates a new instance of ItemBuilder with the specified Material and the specified amount
        Parameters:
        material - The material of the ItemStack to build
        amount - The amount for the ItemStack to build
        Returns:
        A new instance of ItemBuilder

      • newBuilder

        static ItemBuilder newBuilder(org.bukkit.Material material,
                              int amount,
                              byte data)
        Creates a new instance of ItemBuilder with the specified Material, the specified amount and byte data
        Parameters:
        material - The material of the ItemStack to build
        amount - The amount for the ItemStack to build
        data - Byte data for the item(passed through)
        Returns:
        A new instance of ItemBuilder

      • newArmorBuilder

        static LeatherArmorBuilder newArmorBuilder(org.bukkit.Material material)
        Creates a new instance of LeatherArmorBuilder with the specified Material

        The specified Material should be any of the Leather pieces of armor like Material.LEATHER_CHESTPLATE, the builder won't raise an error when the Material isn't valid until you call the LeatherArmorBuilder.build() method

        Parameters:
        material - The material of the ItemStack to build
        Returns:
        A new instance of LeatherArmorBuilder

      • newFireworkBuilder

        static FireworkBuilder newFireworkBuilder(org.bukkit.Material material)
        Creates a new instance of FireworkBuilder with the specified Material

        The specified Material should be Material.FIREWORK, the builder won't raise an error when the Material isn't valid until you call the FireworkBuilder.build() method

        Parameters:
        material - The material of the ItemStack to build
        Returns:
        A new instance of FireworkBuilder

      • newFireworkBuilder

        static FireworkBuilder newFireworkBuilder(org.bukkit.Material material,
                                          int amount)
        Creates a new instance of FireworkBuilder with the specified Material and the specified amount

        The specified Material should be Material.FIREWORK, the builder won't raise an error when the Material isn't valid until you call the FireworkBuilder.build() method

        Parameters:
        material - The material of the ItemStack to build
        amount - The amount of ItemStack to build
        Returns:
        A new instance of FireworkBuilder
